info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 9:23PM EST until further notice by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... South Anna River near Ashland affecting Hanover County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Anna River near Ashland. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water begins to flood lowlands downstream of gage in the vicinity of VA routes 686 and 667. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Friday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage by late this evening and remain above flood stage through much of the night. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 930 AM EST.
